title: Local Lattice Distortion and Chemical Short-Range Order in High-Entropy Alloys
content: The multi-principal-element alloys, or high-entropy alloys (HEAs), are single-phase alloys composed of a number of elements. Even though the diffraction peaks, which represent the average lattice, indicate perfect periodicity, locally the lattice is distorted. Also, elements are not fully randomly distributed, but locally they show chemical preferences, resulting in the compositional (chemical) short-range order (CSRO). These local variations have major effects on the properties of the HEAs, including the mechanical properties.
